33 namespace TiledArray {
34 namespace detail {
35 
37 
49 template <typename Result, typename Left, typename Right, bool LeftConsumable,
50  bool RightConsumable>
51 class Mult {
52  public:
53  typedef Mult<Result, Left, Right, LeftConsumable, RightConsumable> Mult_;
54  typedef Left left_type;
55  typedef Right right_type;
56  typedef Result result_type;
57 
59  static constexpr bool left_is_consumable =
60  LeftConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
62  static constexpr bool right_is_consumable =
63  RightConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
64 
65  private:
66  // Permuting tile evaluation function
67  // These operations cannot consume the argument tile since this operation
68  // requires temporary storage space.
69 
70  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second,
71  const Permutation& perm) {
72  using TiledArray::mult;
73  return mult(first, second, perm);
74  }
75 
76  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second,
77  const Permutation& perm) {
78  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
79  return result_type();
80  }
81 
82  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor,
83  const Permutation& perm) {
84  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
85  return result_type();
86  }
87 
88  // Non-permuting tile evaluation functions
89  // The compiler will select the correct functions based on the
90  // consumability of the arguments.
91 
92  template <bool LC, bool RC,
93  typename std::enable_if<!(LC || RC)>::type* = nullptr>
94  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second) {
95  using TiledArray::mult;
96  return mult(first, second);
97  }
98 
99  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
100  static result_type eval(left_type& first, const right_type& second) {
101  using TiledArray::mult_to;
102  return mult_to(first, second);
103  }
104 
105  template <bool LC, bool RC,
106  typename std::enable_if<!LC && RC>::type* = nullptr>
107  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, right_type& second) {
108  using TiledArray::mult_to;
109  return mult_to(second, first);
110  }
111 
112  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!RC>::type* = nullptr>
113  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second) {
114  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
115  return result_type();
116  }
117 
118  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<RC>::type* = nullptr>
119  static result_type eval(ZeroTensor, right_type& second) {
120  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
121  return result_type();
122  }
123 
124  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!LC>::type* = nullptr>
125  static result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor) {
126  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
127  return result_type();
128  }
129 
130  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
131  static result_type eval(left_type& first, ZeroTensor) {
132  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
133  return result_type();
134  }
135 
136  public:
138 
146  template <typename L, typename R>
147  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right, const Permutation& perm) const {
148  return eval(std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right), perm);
149  }
150 
152 
159  template <typename L, typename R>
160  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right) const {
161  return Mult_::template eval<left_is_consumable, right_is_consumable>(
162  std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right));
163  }
164 
166 
172  template <typename R>
173  result_type consume_left(left_type& left, R&& right) const {
174  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
175  is_consumable_tile<left_type>::value &&
176  std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
177  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
178  right_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<R>::value || can_consume_left);
179  return Mult_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
180  left, std::forward<R>(right));
181  }
182 
184 
190  template <typename L>
191  result_type consume_right(L&& left, right_type& right) const {
192  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
193  is_consumable_tile<right_type>::value &&
194  std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
195  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
196  left_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<L>::value || can_consume_right);
197  return Mult_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
198  std::forward<L>(left), right);
199  }
200 
201 }; // class Mult
202 
204 
218 template <typename Result, typename Left, typename Right, typename Scalar,
219  bool LeftConsumable, bool RightConsumable>
220 class ScalMult {
221  public:
222  typedef ScalMult<Result, Left, Right, Scalar, LeftConsumable,
223  RightConsumable>
224  ScalMult_;
225  typedef Left left_type;
226  typedef Right right_type;
227  typedef Scalar scalar_type;
228  typedef Result result_type;
229 
231  static constexpr bool left_is_consumable =
232  LeftConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
234  static constexpr bool right_is_consumable =
235  RightConsumable && std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
236 
237  private:
238  scalar_type factor_;
239 
240  // Permuting tile evaluation function
241  // These operations cannot consume the argument tile since this operation
242  // requires temporary storage space.
243 
244  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second,
245  const Permutation& perm) const {
246  using TiledArray::mult;
247  return mult(first, second, factor_, perm);
248  }
249 
250  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second,
251  const Permutation& perm) const {
252  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
253  return result_type();
254  }
255 
256  result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor,
257  const Permutation& perm) const {
258  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
259  return result_type();
260  }
261 
262  // Non-permuting tile evaluation functions
263  // The compiler will select the correct functions based on the
264  // consumability of the arguments.
265 
266  template <bool LC, bool RC,
267  typename std::enable_if<!(LC || RC)>::type* = nullptr>
268  result_type eval(const left_type& first, const right_type& second) const {
269  using TiledArray::mult;
270  return mult(first, second, factor_);
271  }
272 
273  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
274  result_type eval(left_type& first, const right_type& second) const {
275  using TiledArray::mult_to;
276  return mult_to(first, second, factor_);
277  }
278 
279  template <bool LC, bool RC,
280  typename std::enable_if<!LC && RC>::type* = nullptr>
281  result_type eval(const left_type& first, right_type& second) const {
282  using TiledArray::mult_to;
283  return mult_to(second, first, factor_);
284  }
285 
286  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!RC>::type* = nullptr>
287  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, const right_type& second) const {
288  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
289  return result_type();
290  }
291 
292  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<RC>::type* = nullptr>
293  result_type eval(ZeroTensor, right_type& second) const {
294  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
295  return result_type();
296  }
297 
298  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<!LC>::type* = nullptr>
299  result_type eval(const left_type& first, ZeroTensor) const {
300  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
301  return result_type();
302  }
303 
304  template <bool LC, bool RC, typename std::enable_if<LC>::type* = nullptr>
305  result_type eval(left_type& first, ZeroTensor) const {
306  TA_ASSERT(false); // Invalid arguments for this operation
307  return result_type();
308  }
309 
310  public:
311  // Compiler generated functions
312  ScalMult(const ScalMult_&) = default;
313  ScalMult(ScalMult_&&) = default;
314  ~ScalMult() = default;
315  ScalMult_& operator=(const ScalMult_&) = default;
316  ScalMult_& operator=(ScalMult_&&) = default;
317 
319 
321  explicit ScalMult(const Scalar factor) : factor_(factor) {}
322 
324 
332  template <typename L, typename R>
333  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right, const Permutation& perm) const {
334  return eval(std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right), perm);
335  }
336 
338 
345  template <typename L, typename R>
346  result_type operator()(L&& left, R&& right) const {
347  return ScalMult_::template eval<left_is_consumable, right_is_consumable>(
348  std::forward<L>(left), std::forward<R>(right));
349  }
350 
352 
358  template <typename R>
359  result_type consume_left(left_type& left, R&& right) const {
360  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
361  is_consumable_tile<left_type>::value &&
362  std::is_same<result_type, left_type>::value;
363  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
364  right_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<R>::value || can_consume_left);
365  return ScalMult_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
366  left, std::forward<R>(right));
367  }
368 
370 
377  template <typename L>
378  result_type consume_right(L&& left, right_type& right) const {
379  constexpr bool can_consume_right =
380  is_consumable_tile<right_type>::value &&
381  std::is_same<result_type, right_type>::value;
382  constexpr bool can_consume_left =
383  left_is_consumable && !(std::is_const<L>::value || can_consume_right);
384  return ScalMult_::template eval<can_consume_left, can_consume_right>(
385  std::forward<L>(left), right);
386  }
387 
388 }; // class ScalMult
389 
390 } // namespace detail
391 } // namespace TiledArray
